result.execSummary:
The defendant Brendan Corcoran Pope was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12/1/16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to time now being served.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan Corcoran Pope

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction - consecutive to time now being served; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Brendan Corcoran Pope in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Brendan Corcoran Pope in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Mark A. Pecora in court, defendant Brendan Corcoran Pope not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel received an offer today, and requests a plea date.  Any motions to be filed within 14 days.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/5/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Brendan Corcoran Pope in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Brendan Corcoran Pope in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/30/15 @ 1:30 pm
